Model

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • Model.Board

  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    Class handling the gameBoard attribute of a master Game object. In that instance, objects of type Player move along Spaces and manipulate instances of OwnableSpace.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Board()
      Constructor for a Board object that instantiates all contents of boardSpaces as generic Space objects.
      Board(int nPlayers)
      Constructor for a Board object that arranges Space instances on boardSpaces in a random order.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Board

        public Board(int nPlayers)
        Constructor for a Board object that arranges Space instances on boardSpaces in a random order.

        This constructor initializes objects of type Space, TaxSpace, ChanceSpace, Property, Railroad, and Utility. The last three are subclasses of OwnableSpace.

        Generic Space objects are always set at indices 0, 8, 16, and 24 of boardSpaces. TaxSpace and ChanceSpace instances, meanwhile, are given random indices that are not yet occupied. Lastly, this constructor arranges instances of OwnableSpace in the order that is specified in the Reference class static variables in consecutive available spaces.

        Parameters:
        nPlayers - Integer that holds the number of players in the Game. This is used in determining the REQUIRED_FOOT_TRAFFIC attribute of a Property object that is instantiated in this constructor.
        See Also:
        Reference

      • Board

        public Board()
        Constructor for a Board object that instantiates all contents of boardSpaces as generic Space objects.

        The method setNewSpace() below takes the function of placing new instances of Space and its subclasses to a Board object's boardSpaces attribute with a specified identifier and index.

        See Also:
        setNewSpace(int, int, int)

    • Method Detail

      • randomGen

        public int randomGen(int nLo,
                     int nHi)
        Method that generates random numbers within the range 0-31 inclusive. This is used in the random Board constructor to randomize the indices of TaxSpace, ChanceSpace, Railroad, and Utility instances within the boardSpaces attribute;
        Parameters:
        nLo - Integer defining the minimum number that can be generated (0).
        nHi - Integer defining the maximum number that can be generated (31).
        Returns:
        Integer that is within the range nLo-nHi, inclusive.

      • consolePrintBoard

        public void consolePrintBoard()
        Console printing method that displays the contents of boardSpaces on the environment console. Used only in program testing and confirmation.

      • getBoardSpaces

        public java.util.ArrayList<Space> getBoardSpaces()
        Getter method for the boardSpaces attribute of this class.
        Returns:
        boardSpaces ArrayList of Space objects that holds the contents of the Board object.

      • setNewSpace

        public void setNewSpace(int nIndex,
                        int nID,
                        int nPlayers)
        Equivalent setter method for the contents of the boardSpaces attribute of this class. This method sets, instead of adds, instances of either Property, Railroad, Utility, ChanceSpace, or TaxSpace to the existing indices of boardSpaces.
        Parameters:
        nIndex - Integer holding the boardSpaces position that is to be changed.
        nID - Integer that is predefined to allow for easy determination of what will be instantiated at index nID
        nPlayers - Integer that holds the number of players in the Game. This is used in determining the REQUIRED_FOOT_TRAFFIC attribute of a Property object that is instantiated in this method.
